message.content:
cs.GT, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.MA, cs.NE 

The paper deals with the analysis of learning dynamics in potential games, which is a classic topic in game theory (cs.GT). The paper also proposes a novel quantitative framework for analyzing the efficiency of potential games, which involves computing regions of attraction and analyzing the behavior of replicator dynamics (cs.SI). The paper uses geometric characterizations to examine issues such as point-wise convergence and system invariants, which are relevant to machine learning and optimization (cs.LG, cs.MA). Finally, the paper applies the proposed framework to networked coordination and congestion games, which are examples of complex systems that can be modeled using network science and graph theory (cs.NE).
